author: jonny.derp
content: <@476250636548308992> we should start to see persistent committee membership evenly spread across all 64 subnets on topaz, right?

author: nishant0
content: although it will be a bit slow, most users don't update their nodes that often

author: nishant0
content:
and we don't have a release tagged with that change yet, so most of the users will be
running the old images

author: jonny.derp
content: Ok makes sense.  I was going to ask how good they were about updating nodes

author: nishant0
content: Are you seeing any persistent committees in topaz now, using your network tool ?

author: jonny.derp
content: I looked yesterday.  I saw one node subscribed to 13 and the rest in 0-5.  That being said I am only able to consistently discover 200 nodes.

author: nishant0
content: ok , it seems like users are slow to update. It should be more obvious in the next few days

author: jonny.derp
content: Cool deal.  I'll let you know what I see

author: jonny.derp
content:
Does anyone know what testnet this fork_digest belongs to? 

`28e2f490`

I noticed it while crawling topaz yesterday.  The fork digests i see are:

`f071c66c` - topaz
`9925efd6` - schlesi

author: protolambda
content: Probably the fork digest I mistakenly created by running prysm with topaz eth1 contract, but schlesi network. Got the wrong genesis state, and had fork digest problems

author: protolambda
content: See interop channel in prysm discord

author: jonny.derp
content: gotcha...thanks.  I just wanted to make sure it wasn't another testnet i hadn't heard of
